content: Yes, the influence of other languages has affected contemporary Tamil usage. There have been several borrowings from other languages, particularly from English, Sanskrit, and Urdu, which have become a part of contemporary Tamil vocabulary. For example, words such as "computer," "telephone," "coffee," "pencil," and "camera" are commonly used in Tamil, which are originally borrowed from English. Similarly, several technical and scientific terms have been borrowed from Sanskrit, while words related to religion, law, and administration have been borrowed from Urdu. The influence of other languages has also led to the evolution of new words and expressions in Tamil. Overall, the impact of other languages on contemporary Tamil usage has been significant.
